column1: Tayga (Russian: Тайга́) is a town in Kemerovo Oblast
column3: located 118 kilometers (73 mi) northwest of Kemerovo. Population: 25
column6: 233 (1989 Census).The town is one of the biggest railway junctions in Russia.

column1: The town is a railroad junction on Trans-Siberian Railway
column2: and also the starting point of the Tayga–Bely Yar branch of the Western Siberian Railway

column1: Tayga was founded in the end of the 19th century due to the construction of the Trans-Siberian Railway. The station was opened in 1898. In 1911
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as Tayga Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Tayga Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction is incorporated as Tayginsky Urban Okrug.

column1: Tayga contains ten objects classified as cultural and historical heritage of local significance. Five of them are monuments of architecture
column2: and the other five are monuments of history.
